attributes.action: MP’s pay and pensions should be linked to public sector pay and state pensions
attributes.additional_details:
It is ridiculous for MP’s to receive higher percentage pay increases than the lowest paid public sector workers. 
It is also ridiculous that MP’s can vote for working people to receive their state pension ( that they have paid into for years) at a higher age than MP’s can claim their own overly generous pension. 
If we are “ all in it together “ let include MP’s be in on it with us. 
I m sure they would want to lead by example.
attributes.background:
MP’s are public sector workers, they should receive the same pay rise each years as the lowest public sector increase, including pay freezes if used.
MP’s pensions are paid out of U.K. tax revenues, they should only be able to start claiming it at the age people start to claim state pension

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
